javadoc: Manages mappings between DWARF DIEs and Ghidra DataTypes.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: prog
params.comment: DWARFProgram that holds the Ghidra Program being imported.

params.name: importSummary
params.comment:
DWARFImportSummary where summary information will be stored
 during the import session.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a {@link DataType} from the DWARF {@link DIEAggregate DIEA}, or returns a pre-existing {@link DataType} created by the specified DIEA previously.

Creating a new DataType happens in two stages, where the DataType is created as an 'impl' DataType first (possibly representing a large graph of referred-to datatypes), and then it is submitted to the {@link DataTypeManager} to be added to the database and converted to a 'db' object.

Mapping from the DIEA's offset to the resultant 'db' DataType object is a two step process.

A {@link DataTypeGraphComparator} is used to walk the 'impl' DataType object graph in lock-step with the resultant 'db' DataType object graph, and the mapping between the 'impl' object and its creator DIEA (held in {@link #currentImplDataTypeToDIE}) is used to create a mapping to the resultant 'db' DataType's path. @param diea DWARF {@link DIEAggregate} with datatype information that needs to be converted to a Ghidra DataType. @return {@link DataType} that is ready to use. @throws IOException if problem @throws DWARFExpressionException if problem
methods.name: doGetDataType
methods.comment:
Creates a DataType from the DWARF DIEAggregate, or returns a
 pre-existing DataType created by the specified DIEA previously.
 
 Creating a new DataType happens in two stages, where the DataType is created as
 an 'impl' DataType first (possibly representing a large graph of referred-to datatypes),
 and then it is submitted to the DataTypeManager to be added to the database and
 converted to a 'db' object.
 
 Mapping from the DIEA's offset to the resultant 'db' DataType object is a two step
 process.
 
 A DataTypeGraphComparator is used to walk the 'impl' DataType object graph
 in lock-step with the resultant 'db' DataType object graph, and the mapping between
 the 'impl' object and its creator DIEA (held in #currentImplDataTypeToDIE)
 is used to create a mapping to the resultant 'db' DataType's path.

params.name: diea
params.comment:
DWARF DIEAggregate with datatype information that needs to be converted
 to a Ghidra DataType.

return.comment: DataType that is ready to use.

methods.javadoc:
Marks the DWARF DIE at the specified offset as a string.
@param dieOffset the DWARF DIE offset.
methods.name: setAsStringType
methods.comment: Marks the DWARF DIE at the specified offset as a string.

methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment:
Returns a Ghidra DataType corresponding to the specified DIEAggregate,
 or the specified defaultValue if the DIEA param is null or does not map to an already
 defined datatype (registered with #addType(long, DataType, DWARFImportSummary)).

params.name: diea
params.comment: DIEAggregate that defines a data type

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment:
Ghidra DataType to return if the specified DIEA is null
 or not already defined.

methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment:
Returns a Ghidra DataType corresponding to the specified DIE (based on its
 offset), or the specified defaultValue if the DIE does not map to a defined
 datatype (registered with #addType(long, DataType, DWARFImportSummary)).

params.name: dieOffset
params.comment: offset of a DIE record that defines a data type

params.name: defaultValue
params.comment: Ghidra DataType to return if the specified DIE not already defined.

methods.name: getStorageDataType
methods.comment:
Returns the DataType that the passed-in DIEAggregate defines,
 except when it was a char array of undefined length, then it returns a StringDataType
 that can be used to detect the size of the null-terminated string in memory.

methods.name: getPtrTo
methods.comment: Returns a pointer to the specified data type.

return.comment: a Pointer that points to the specified datatype.

methods.name: forAllConflicts
methods.comment:
Iterate all DataTypes that match the CategoryPath / name given
 in the DataTypePath parameter, including "conflict" datatypes
 that have a ".CONFLICTxx" suffix.

methods.name: getOffsetType
methods.comment:
Returns a Ghidra DataType that corresponds to a type
 that can be used to represent an offset.

methods.name: isCharType
methods.comment: Returns true if the data type is one of the standard character types.

return.comment: true if the specified datatype is one of the many char data types.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the void type.
@return void {@link DataType}
methods.name: getVoidType

methods.javadoc:
Returns datatype to hold a 1 byte undefined value.
@return undefined 1 byte {@link DataType}.
methods.name: getUndefined1Type
methods.comment: Returns datatype to hold a 1 byte undefined value.

methods.name: getBaseType
methods.comment: Returns a DWARF base data type based on its name, or null if it does not exist.

return.comment: DataType or null if base type does not exist

methods.javadoc:
Returns a Ghidra {@link DataType datatype} that corresponds to the DWARF named type.

If there is no direct matching named Ghidra type, generic types of matching size will be returned for integer and floating numeric dwarf encoding types, boolean, and character types. Failing that, generic storage types of matching size (word, dword, etc) will be returned, and failing that, an array of the correct size will be returned.

If the returned data type is not a direct named match, the returned data type will be wrapped in a Ghdira typedef using the dwarf type's name.

Any newly created Ghidra data types will be cached and the same instance will be returned if the same DWARF named base type is requested again.

@param name @param dwarfSize @param dwarfEncoding @param isBigEndian @return
methods.name: getBaseType
methods.comment:
Returns a Ghidra DataType that corresponds to the DWARF named type.
 
 If there is no direct matching named Ghidra type, generic types of matching
 size will be returned for integer and floating numeric dwarf encoding types, boolean,
 and character types.  Failing that, generic storage types of matching size
 (word, dword, etc) will be returned, and failing that, an array of the correct size
 will be returned.
 
 If the returned data type is not a direct named match, the returned data type
 will be wrapped in a Ghdira typedef using the dwarf type's name.
 
 Any newly created Ghidra data types will be cached and the same instance will be returned
 if the same DWARF named base type is requested again.

methods.name: importAllDataTypes
methods.comment:
Does the actual import work.  Updates the #importSummary object
 with information about the types imported and errors encountered.

throws.comment: if errors are encountered reading data
if the TaskMonitor is canceled by the user.

methods.name: getFunctionSignature
methods.comment:
Construct a temporary 'impl' FunctionDefinition DataType using the information
 found in the specified DIEAggregate.

params.name: diea
params.comment: DIEAggregate of a subprogram, callsite, etc.

return.comment:
FunctionDefinition impl (not saved to the DB) or null if not a valid
 DIEA.

name: DWARFDataTypeManager
comment: Manages mappings between DWARF DIEs and Ghidra DataTypes.
